task_summary: Robot arm locates and approaches a towel placed on a workspace using visual perception and sequential movement.

task_long_description.overview: The episode displays a robot arm tasked to reach a soft towel lying on a green artificial grass mat atop a tabletop. The robot must first visually identify the towel in its workspace, then execute a movement sequence to approach and reach the towel. All actions are supported by object detection and feedback to verify success. Scene comprises pink towel, green mat, table, dual-arm robot, typical lab lighting. The task is to reach the towel precisely without grasping.
preconditions: Robot at default or home position
success_criteria: Robot's end-effector is at the towel's location
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive towel: scan until found (max_attempts=3)
Movement errors: abort and re-detect towel
Localization drift: re-check position after movement
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends when robot confirms arrival at towel location.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if towel is visible to perception system.
Scans workspace for towel using a line pattern.
Moves robot end-effector to towel's position.

failure_modes: Movement aborted due to collision or error
recovery_strategy: Rescan up to 3 times if towel not visible
Abort movement and re-detect if error occurs
Verify position after move; restart if incorrect
assumptions: Instruction 'Reach a towel' does not require grasping/touching in this episode: frames show approach but no grip.
Workspace and robots remain stable across all frames; towel is static.
No manipulation (grasping/holding) is visible; only approach.
Green artificial mat included for contrast, not as part of manipulation.

expected_success_criteria: Robot end-effector is positioned at the towel's location
